thread.title: A debate that should narrow the field and focus on issues
thread.title_full: A debate that should narrow the field and focus on issues - San Francisco Chronicle

author: San Francisco Chronicle
title: A debate that should narrow the field and focus on issues
text:
Photo: Joe Raedle LAS VEGAS, NV - OCTOBER 13: Democratic presidential candidates Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) (L) and Hillary Clinton take part in a presidential debate sponsored by CNN and Facebook at Wynn Las Vegas on October 13, 2015 in Las Vegas, Nevada. Five Democratic presidential candidates are participating in the party's first presidential debate. (Photo by Joe Raedle/Getty Images) ***BESTPIX*** LAS VEGAS, NV - OCTOBER 13: Democratic presidential candidates Sen....
The country got a sharp and defining look at the Democratic presidential field, with no doubt that hopefuls Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders are locked in a serious matchup. They showcased major policy differences, but turned chummy at one point when Sanders shrugged off the furor over Clinton’s “damn e-mails.’’ LAS VEGAS, NV - OCTOBER 13: Democratic presidential candidates Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-VT) (L) and Hillary Clinton take part in a presidential debate sponsored by CNN and Facebook at Wynn Las Vegas on October 13, 2015 in Las Vegas, Nevada. Five Democratic presidential candidates are participating in the party's first presidential debate. (Photo by Joe Raedle/Getty Images) ***BESTPIX*** LAS VEGAS, NV - OCTOBER 13: Democratic presidential candidates Sen....
The country got a sharp and defining look at the Democratic presidential field, with no doubt that hopefuls Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders are locked in a serious matchup. They showcased major policy differences, but turned chummy at one point when Sanders shrugged off the furor over Clinton’s “damn e-mails.’’
